hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Decay Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a macroeconomic or major crypto-specific news event (identified by >500% spike in social volume for top 10 crypto terms), if BTC's price opens with a gap >3% and the first 2-hour realized volatility exceeds 5% (annualized), then fading the initial move (selling if gap up, buying if gap down) at the close of that 2-hour candle will be profitable over the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional momentum. Large opening gaps on news often represent an overreaction by emotional and algorithmic traders. Extreme short-term volatility in the first 2 hours indicates panic/euphoria, which frequently fades as liquidity normalizes and the news is digested, leading to a partial gap fill.
entry_conditions: Major news event detected (social volume spike >500%)
BTC opening gap vs prior close > |3%|

exit_conditions.take_profit: 6 hours after entry OR price returns to within 1% of pre-gap close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves against entry by > 1.5x the initial gap size

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median 6-hour return after entry is negative, or the gap continues to widen more than 40% of the time under these conditions.
